questions.question: How can you characterise a transition state from its frequency calculation?

answers.a: It will have multiple negative frequency
answers.b: It will have one negative frequency
answers.c: It will one less mode of vibration
answers.d: It will one more mode of vibration

explanations.b: A transition state will have one negative frequency due to negative force constant obtained from double derivative of its energy.

questions.question: Taking the example of SN2 reaction, which of the following is true?

answers.a: The reactant has higher number of vibrational modes than transition state
answers.b: The transition state has higher number of vibrational modes than both products and reactants
answers.c: The transition state is more stable than both reactants and products

explanations.b: The transition state has higher number of atoms than both reactant and product and hence will have higher vibrational modes.

questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding the use of catalysts is false?

answers.a: Catalysts lower the energy of the transition state
answers.b: Catalysts increase the proportion of molecules that possess sufficient energy to clear the activation energy barrier
answers.c: Catalysts increase the number of reactions that can happen spontaneous
answers.d: Catalysts provide an alternative reaction pathway from reactant to product

explanations.a: Catalyst decrease the activation energy of the reaction, i.e lower the energy of the transition state, as its energy is the activation energy of the reaction.

questions.question: How many vibrational degrees of freedom will NH<sub>3</sub> have at its second order saddle point?

explanations.c: Saddles points have lesser degrees of freedom than minimum energy structures, a second order saddle point will have two lesser vibrational degrees of freedom. For NH<sub>3</sub>, this stands as 3N-8 i.e. 4
